III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12214
Section Compliance with the child protection law
Description • (1) An agency shall comply with the child protection law,
1975 PA 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency failed to report suspected child abuse.
Investigation On 5/6/2025 an email was sent to Adult 1, the alleged victim
in this case, requesting an interview. The email predates the
initiation of the current investigation as the original complaint was
opened mistakenly against another agency. Adult 1 did not
respond to this request for an interview. There was no phone
number provided for Adult 1.
On 6/23/2025, an email was sent to Adult 1 requesting an
interview. Adult 1 did not respond to this second request for an
interview.
Adoption Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
7/2/2025. Adoption Supervisor reported Foster Parent A has been
a licensed foster parent with the agency since 7/03/1994.
Adoption Supervisor confirmed Adult 1 and her sister, Adult 2,
were once placed at the home of Foster Parent A. Adoption
Supervisor referred this consultant to the agency Licensing
Supervisor for additional information.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
7/2/2025. Licensing Supervisor reported Foster Parent A has been
licensed with the agency since 7/3/1995. Licensing Supervisor
reported there have been “a lot of investigations” of the foster
home, for allegations of physical abuse or withholding food.
Licensing Supervisor reported that often another DHHS worker
was also involved in the investigations of the home but allegations
of abuse or neglect were never substantiated. Licensing
Supervisor reported that agency investigations did not confirm
physical abuse or neglect had occurred in the home. Licensing
Supervisor reported Foster Parent A would take placement of
difficult children into her home. Licensing Supervisor confirmed
Adult 1 and Adult 2 were placed into the home of Foster Parent A.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
7/15/2025. Chief Administrator reported Adult 1 had contacted her
2

in 2020 or 2021 and wanted to meet with her about concerns she
had about the home of Foster Parent A. Chief Administrator
reported Adult 1 came to her office and they met and talked about
the concerns Adult 1 had. Chief Administrator reported Adult 1 told
her of the abuse and neglect she witnessed and was committed
by Foster Parent A when she was placed there as a child. Chief
Administrator reported she then called Centralized Intake to report
the alleged abuse. Chief Administrator reported she filed a DHS-
3200. Chief Administrator further reported the agency initiated a
special evaluation of the foster home. Chief Administrator reported
she had no prior knowledge of the allegations reported by Adult 1.
Chief Administrator reported there has not been findings of abuse
or neglect of Foster Parent A. Chief Administrator reported she
would send documents including her case notes of the meeting
from Adult 1.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEW:
Case Meeting Notes: Chief administrator submitted her meeting
notes with Adult 1. The notes are dated 4/21/2021 and offer a
narrative of the meeting. Adult 1 describes abuse she witnessed
while placed in the home of Foster Parent A. Adult 1 reports
sexual abuse, physical abuse with belts and rulers as well as
verbal abuse, calling children that resided in the home “retarded”
and “bitches”. The meeting notes document Adult 1 felt she
needed to report this abuse now. The meeting notes further
document Adult 1 informed Chief Administrator she never felt
comfortable reporting these concerns to case managers. The
notes document Adult 1 had previously reported the allegations to
DHHS but was told the allegations are historic and nothing could
be done. The notes document Adult 1 reported she had resided in
the home of Foster Parent A from the time she was age 10 until
age 18.
Email: An email from Chief Administrator on 9/3/2025 reports that
Adult 1 was in the foster home of Foster Parent A from 3/22/2005
to 05/13/2011. Documentation in MISACWIS was not available
regarding the case of Adult 1.
Special Evaluation # 2021C0629768 was reviewed. The
evaluation was initiated by the agency on 4/21/2021 and the
evaluation included DHHS Worker. The evaluation involved
allegations of abuse as reported by Adult 1 to Chief Administrator.
Upon review of the evaluation there were no rule violations
established.
3

DHS-3200. The DHS-3200 was reviewed and indicates the
allegations described by Adult 1 were documented. The DHS-
3200 was completed on 4/21/2021.
Analysis Adult 1 did not respond to requests for an interview. Adult 1
reported to Chief Administrator during the 4/21/2021 meeting that
she had previously reported the alleged abuse/neglect allegations
to DHHS and was told it was historic and nothing could be done.
Adult 1 reported she had not previously reported her concerns to
agency staff.
The agency filed a DHS-3200 with Centralized Intake upon
hearing the abuse/neglect allegations from Adult 1 on 4/21/2021.
The agency initiated a special evaluation of the foster home on
4/21/2021.
The agency reported suspected abuse and/or neglect as required.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted regarding an allegation that Catholic Charities of Southeast Michigan failed to report suspected child abuse by a foster parent. The investigation found that the agency's Chief Administrator did file a formal report (DHS-3200) and initiated a special evaluation upon learning of the historic allegations in 2021, and therefore complied with the law. The report concludes the agency is not culpable for the failure-to-report allegation, as the required actions were taken when the information was formally presented to the agency's leadership.
